creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by the artist with the assistance of Keiko Gallery
description: curving, organic, triangular form with clipped and beveled edge; smooth, reflective black lacquer
medium: Lacquer and hemp cloth on polyurethane
text: Besides monumental sculptures like the nearby Voyage of Time, Igawa also makes smaller black and red polished sculptures like this one here which evokes flight into the night sky. Their minimalist shapes are somewhat reminiscent of the elegant, razor-sharp, pale-blue glazed porcelain sculptures of the contemporary artist Fukami Sueharu exhibited in gallery 253.
title: To the Night
